summary: This document contains various financial records related to Cypress, Inc., including certifications of beneficial ownership and due diligence checks. It highlights the involvement of Jeffrey Epstein as a beneficial owner and key individual in the company, along with details about the company's address and financial activities. This document contains various corporate resolutions and bylaws for Cypress, Inc., including the authorization of bank accounts, the appointment of officers, and the indemnification of directors and officers. It outlines the powers and responsibilities of the corporation's officers and directors, as well as the procedures for handling corporate transactions.

connections.description: Darren Indyke serves as an attorney for Jeffrey Epstein and is involved in the management of Cypress, Inc.
Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn both hold positions within Cypress, Inc., with Indyke as Secretary and Kahn as Treasurer.
Richard Kahn serves as Treasurer under President Jeffrey Epstein at Cypress, Inc.
Jeanne Brennan is an Accountant working under President Jeffrey Epstein at Cypress, Inc.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is listed as the beneficial owner of Cypress, Inc., with a 100% ownership stake.
Cypress, Inc. was established on November 22, 2011, and has reported zero annual sales.
The document includes multiple references to Epstein's personal and business addresses in St. Thomas, USVI.
Darren Indyke is identified as an authorized signer for Cypress, Inc., indicating his involvement in the company's operations.
The document contains various compliance checks and certifications related to the financial activities of Cypress, Inc.
Cypress, Inc. was formed solely for the purpose of holding certain real estate.
Darren Indyke confirmed that Cypress, Inc. never conducted any business since its incorporation.
The corporation's Articles of Incorporation were filed on November 12, 2011.
Jeffrey Epstein is authorized to execute agreements on behalf of Cypress, Inc.
The document includes provisions for indemnification of directors and officers.
